passage: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes: • Cycling infrastructure in urban areas reduces traffic congestion. • Bike-sharing programs have become increasingly popular in many cities. • The construction of dedicated bike lanes can improve cyclist safety. • The health benefits of cycling include increased cardiovascular fitness and reduced stress levels.
question: Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to emphasize the benefits of promoting cycling in urban areas?

choices.A: Many cities have implemented bike-sharing programs to reduce traffic congestion.
choices.B: Promoting cycling in urban areas can lead to reduced traffic congestion, improved cyclist safety, and numerous health benefits.
choices.C: Cycling contributes to cardiovascular fitness and stress reduction.
choices.D: The construction of bike lanes is necessary for the safety of cyclists in urban areas.

explanation: B: 'Promoting cycling in urban areas can lead to reduced traffic congestion, improved cyclist safety, and numerous health benefits.' is the correct answer because it effectively combines multiple notes to emphasize the benefits of promoting cycling in urban areas.
distractor_explanation: 'Many cities have implemented bike-sharing programs to reduce traffic congestion.' is incorrect because it focuses on only one aspect of promoting cycling in urban areas.

'Cycling contributes to cardiovascular fitness and stress reduction.' is incorrect because it only addresses the health benefits of cycling, not the overall benefits of promoting cycling in urban areas.

'The construction of bike lanes is necessary for the safety of cyclists in urban areas.' is incorrect because it only discusses one specific solution for improving cyclist safety and does not emphasize the broader benefits of promoting cycling in urban areas.
